title: Musk is ruining Tesla for these French owners
summary: An unwitting political symbol, the fast, eco-friendly and progressive car has become an encumbrance on wheels since the company's boss entered US politics.

title: French voters' mistrust of politics aggravated since snap elections, gap with neighbors widens
summary: France appears to be an island of pessimism, according to a political confidence barometer published by Cevipof on February 11, while Germany, Italy and the Netherlands, which are also going through turbulent times, have kept up a much higher level of confidence.

title: US defense chief suggests Ukraine should abandon hope of winning all territory back from Russia
summary: US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth's warning resembles Moscow's vision, as Russian President Vladimir Putin has declared that any peace deal must ensure that Ukraine gives up its NATO ambitions and withdraws its troops from the four regions that Russia annexed in September 2022 but never fully captured.

title: Judge clears way for Trump’s plan to downsize federal workforce with deferred resignation program
summary: US President Donald Trump wants to use financial incentives to encourage government employees to quit. According to the White House, tens of thousands of workers have taken the government up on its offer.

title: Former Israeli hostages start revealing detention conditions in Gaza
summary: Whether as a sign of defiance toward the government or out of despair at not seeing the return of those still held in the Gaza Strip, the hostages freed since January 19 and their relatives are gradually speaking out to the press.

title: At Paris summit, the US charges against AI 'censorship'
summary: US Vice President JD Vance warned against 'excessive regulation' of AI, particularly in the European Union. In response, Emmanuel Macron and Ursula von der Leyen argued for a 'third way,' while touting their investments in the sector.

title: FEMA yanks back $80 million that New York City meant to cover hotel costs for migrants
summary: New York City Comptroller Brad Lander said the money was discovered to be missing overnight and Lander said no one in his office had been aware that the federal government had access to the city's bank account. Meanwhile, Trump's administration filed a lawsuit against New York on Wednesday accusing the Democratic-ruled state of hindering federal efforts to crack down on undocumented migrants.

title: UK PM vows 'new towns' in England to alleviate housing crunch
summary: The government said in a press release that it was considering more than 100 sites across England for the new urban areas. The towns will be 'well-designed, beautiful communities with affordable housing, GP [doctor's] surgeries, schools and public transport where people will want to live.'

title: Trump says Ukraine talks to start 'immediately' after Putin call
summary: US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin spoke by phone on Wednesday. Trump described the call as 'lengthy and highly productive,' and the Kremlin said the leaders had agreed that the 'time has come to work together.'

title: War in Ukraine: Uncertainty over fate of North Korean soldiers deployed to Kursk
summary: The 10,000 North Koreans sent to this Russian region to fight alongside the Russians withdrew from the area in mid-January after suffering heavy losses.

title: US releases Russian crypto kingpin Vinnik in prisoner exchange, official says
summary: An official said Alexander Vinnik, who had been extradited from Greece to the US in 2022, was being released as part of the exchange with Russia that saw American teacher Marc Fogel freed on Tuesday.

title: Hungary's Orban says far-right AfD is 'future of Germany'
summary: The nationalist leader hosted Alternative for Germany's co-leader Alice Weidel on Wednesday.

title: Tulsi Gabbard confirmed as new US spy chief
summary: Gabbard – appointed to be director of national intelligence – has faced questions over her 2017 meeting with now-deposed Syrian leader Bashar al-Assad and her peddling of Kremlin propaganda, particularly false conspiracy theories about the Ukraine war.

title: Roberto Saviano, outspoken opponent of organized crime and Meloni: 'There is definitely a mafia mentality in Italy'
summary: Forced to live under police protection, the writer has become one of the main intellectual opponents of the Italian prime minister and her far-right government.

title: Macron hosts Modi with geopolitical 'independence' in mind
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited southern France with a packed schedule on Wednesday, February 12, fostering a relationship that Paris sees as an alternative to great power rivalries.

title: EU examines future of its outdated budget
summary: The European Commission wants a more flexible financial framework to meet the challenges, including green technologies, border security and defense, facing the 27 member states.

title: Russia rejects swapping occupied territory with Ukraine after Zelensky suggestion
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky floated the idea of swapping territory as part of a peace deal ahead of a meeting in Munich with US Vice President JD Vance.

title: 'I discovered pornography when I was 14. Very early, I think'
summary: Little informed about sexuality, Assia, 18, who lives near Paris, discovered pornography with her first boyfriend. Exposure to these images and practices left their mark on her.

title: In Haiti, childhood stolen by gangs and impunity
summary: Armed groups operating in Port-au-Prince have 'undermined a myriad of children's human rights,' according to a report by Amnesty International. According to the UN, sexual violence against minors increased tenfold in 2024, and gang recruitment of children rose by 70%.

title: The big breakdown in home equipment sales
summary: In 2024, virtually all housing equipment goods saw their sales plummet. The furniture market fell by 5.1% and major household appliances by 3.9%. Only small appliances are doing well, thanks to the success of the air fryer.

title: Germany's economic crisis is weighing on Central Europe
summary: The stagnation of the continent's leading economy is catching up with the region, which has long served as its subcontracting base. The Czech Republic in particular.

title: How prairie rattlesnakes turn themselves into rain catchers for even the tiniest droplets
summary: A study conducted in the US, on a dry hill in Colorado, has revealed their secret: They curl up and reverse their curvature into a bowl shape. These snakes even share the wealth.

title: In Mexico, 'Emilia Pérez' continues to cause a stir
summary: Jacques Audiard's film, nominated 13 times for an Academy Award, is the target of fierce criticism for stereotyping 'sensitive issues.'

title: In Mexico, 'Emilia Pérez' continues to cause a stir
summary: Jacques Audiard's film, nominated 13 times for an Academy Award, is the target of fierce criticism for stereotyping 'sensitive issues.'

title: Twelve people injured after man throws grenade into French bar
summary: At least two people were left in critical condition after the grenade exploded in a bar in Grenoble, southeastern France, on Wednesday. Investigators believed it was not linked to terrorism, but possibly 'a settling of scores.'

title: Gaza: Trump forces King Abdullah II of Jordan into diplomatic contortions
summary: The Jordanian king refused to answer questions about receiving Gazan Palestinians on his territory, and hid behind upcoming proposals from Egypt. The aim was not to upset Donald Trump, who said he was '99%' certain he would reach an agreement with Cairo.

title: Trump launches Ukraine peace negotiations with Putin, shattering the Allies' unity
summary: Without consulting European leaders, the US president spoke at length with the head of the Kremlin on Wednesday. He also made a much shorter call to Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: A weakened Zelensky acknowledges opening of peace negotiations
summary: The Ukrainian president insisted on including his country in the discussions, asserting that he and US President Donald Trump had agreed to maintain further contact.

title: Örebro massacre: Swedish killer's motive remains unclear
summary: Police were unable to establish any ideological motivation. But the victim's origins, almost all foreign-born, is the subject of debate in a country where anti-immigrant rhetoric has taken hold.

title: 'Ultra-high energy' neutrino detected in Mediterranean
summary: An international collaboration of 68 institutes, including the French National Center for Scientific Research (CNRS), has found evidence of the passage of one of these particles off the coast of Sicily, which could provide information about giant particle gas pedals in the Universe.

title: At the Berlinale, politics is never far from the screen
summary: The upcoming festival, regularly shaken by the echoes of global conflicts, will be held at the same time as the German federal elections.

title: At least 20 injured after car drives into a crowd in Munich
summary: A protest by a service workers' union was taking place at the time of the incident on Thursday. It was not immediately clear whether demonstrators were among the injured.

title: Hamas says it's committed to Gaza truce
summary: The Islamist group added that mediators were pushing for hostages to be released this weekend as planned.

title: BBC's Shipping Forecast, 100 years of positive waves: 'Our national lullaby'
summary: Broadcast since 1925 on public radio in the UK, the Shipping Forecast provides weather forecasts for maritime areas around the British Isles twice a day.

title: Putin offers Trump his first success
summary: The two leaders agreed to open formal negotiations. But, concerning Ukraine, the Russian president reiterated his strict conditions.

title: Murder of French schoolgirl: Indicted suspect wanted to 'steal from someone to calm down'
summary: Louise, age 11, was found dead on February 8 in a wooded area near her home outside Paris. The suspect, Owen L., prone to violent outbursts, had allegedly left home after an online altercation while playing the game 'Fortnite.' He confessed to the murder while in police custody.

title: Ukraine talks: 'Neither Trump nor Putin has yet made a single promise to guarantee Europeans a seat at the table'
summary: Europeans want a seat at the negotiation table for peace in Ukraine, convinced that the security of the continent is at stake, writes Le Monde's Philippe Ricard in his column.

title: US Senate confirms vaccine-sceptic Robert F. Kennedy Jr as health secretary
summary: Despite concerns from those in the medical and science fields, the Republican-controlled US Senate approved Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as health secretary on Thursday.

title: French parliament votes to ban disposable e-cigarettes
summary: The measure banning single-use electronic cigarettes, popular among young people in France, is part of a wider government anti-smoking campaign.

title: How Trump and Musk set out to dismantle USAID
summary: In just 20 days, US President Donald Trump and his close advisors have frozen the functioning of the development aid agency created in 1961.

title: Macron urges Syrian government to ensure 'representative' governance
summary: Speaking after a conference on the situation in Syria, President Emmanuel Macron also called for 'respect' for minority communities. Earlier, Foreign Minister Jean-Noel Barrot said the EU was working on easing sanctions.

title: In checkpoint-ridden West Bank, the exhausting obstacle course for minivan drivers
summary: Israeli military roadblocks have tightened their grip on Palestinian territory since the fighting stopped in Gaza in mid-January. For shared cab drivers and their customers, every journey is a ordeal.

title: Europe warns Trump against Ukraine deal 'behind our backs'
summary: The announcement of talks between US President Donald Trump and Moscow on ending the Ukraine war stunned European allies – several of whom have openly called his strategy into question.

title: Trump announces 'reciprocal tariffs' on both allies and adversaries
summary: US President Donald Trump stated his plans to impose tariffs on products coming to the US from a foreign country at the same level as that country's tariffs on American products, a policy that would also affect US allies.

title: 'Cancer is, at least in part, a political disease'
summary: Focusing solely on individual behavior, genetics and screening in the face of rising cancer rates hides the structural causes of the disease, writes Le Monde's Stéphane Foucart in his column.

title: New York's Saturday night fever, photographed by Meryl Meisler
summary: In the late 1970s, Meryl Meisler discovered New York clubs where a new style of music was all the rage: disco. Joyful young people swayed to hits by Chic, Donna Summer and ABBA. These candid pictures of wild parties will be displayed in the Philharmonie de Paris' exhibition 'Disco - I'm Coming Out,' from February 14 to August 17.
